newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ASX substantial shareholding notices - April 17.
newsitem.headline: ASX substantial shareholding notices - April 17.

text.p: The following substantial shareholder notices have been made to The Australian Stock Exchange (ASX).
Axiom Funds Management Corporation increased its relevant interest in Aristocrat Leisure Limited on 14/04/1997, from 5,512,484 ordinary shares (5.28%) to 6,699,385 ordinary shares (6.42%).
GE Capital International Holdings Corporation increased its relevant interest in Loscam Limited on 09/04/1997, from 102,954,909 ordinary shares (81.74%) to 108,313,509 ordinary shares (85.99%).
Perpetual Trustees Australia Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Jc Ludowici & Son Limited on 16/04/1997, from 1,482,429 ordinary shares (11.92%) to 1,291,861 ordinary shares (10.38%).

Australian and New Zealand Banking Limited became a substantial shareholder in Sydney Aquarium Limited on 11/04/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary share capital of 1,295,544 ordinary shares (6.01%).
Multiplex Construction Pty Limited decreased its relevant interest in Stadium Australia Group on 10/04/1997, from 23,457,000 ordinary shares (64.19%) to 20,628,000 ordinary shares (39.91%).
Packer & Co Ltd changed its relevant interest in Asia Pacific Specialty Chemicals Limited on 14/04/1997, from 3,316,000 ordinary shares (7.67%) to 4,325,000 ordinary shares (6.57%).
Guinness Peat Group Plc increased its relevant interest in Tooth & Company Limited on 14/04/1997, from 27,680,965 ordinary shares (22.24%) to 31,004,920 ordinary shares (24.91%).
Permanent Trustee Company Limited increased its relevant interest in Hawker Richardson Limited on 11/04/1997, from 4,764,897 ordinary shares (12.59%) to 5,490.174 ordinary shares (14.51%).
J.H. Schaffer increased its relevant interest in Tempo Services Limited on 18/03/1997, from 18,429,000 ordinary shares (44.38%) to 19,674,750 ordinary shares (47.38%).
Permanent Trustee Company Limited ceased to be a substantial shareholder in Century Drilling Limited on 14/04/1997.
Hambros Australia Limited decreased its relevant interest in Stadium Australia Group on 08/04/1997, from 23,483,000 ordinary shares (68.91%) to 20,654,000* ordinary shares (60.69%).
Bankers Trust Australia Limited increased its relevant interest in Werrie Gold Limited on 18/04/1997, from 3,023,900 ordinary shares (6.29%) to 6,807,601 ordinary shares (11.56%).
Greenchip Development Capital Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Solace Limited on 15/04/1997, from 6,606,000 ordinary shares (9.88%) to 4,306,000 ordinary shares (5.54%).
Greenchip Investments Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Environmental Solutions International Limited on 15/04/1997, from 5,146,100 ordinary shares (8.45%) to 5,125,843 ordinary shares (6.94%).

Greenchip Development Capital Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Enterprise Solutions Asia Pacific Limited on 16/04/1997, from 9,460,800 ordinary shares (14.16%) to 6,635,000 ordinary shares (7.63%).
Mulloway Pty Ltd increased its relevant interest in Gearhart Australia Limited on 15/04/1997, from 1,294,499 ordinary shares (11.06%) to 1,073,399 ordinary shares (9.14%).
Greenchip Investments Limited ceased to be a substantial shareholder in Joyce Corporation Limited on 11/04/1997.
ABN AMRO Australia Limited decreased* its relevant interest in Stadium Australia Group on 16/04/1997, from 23,475,000 ordinary shares (69.69%) to 20,646,000 ordinary shares (61.47%).
Greenchip Resources Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Reef Mining NL on 15/06/1997, from 4,500,000 ordinary shares (9.48%) to 2,663,985 ordinary shares (5.37%).
